title: The Blockies Guide - Managing weeds on small farms and acres

tasks.task: Managing and controlling weeds on a property
subtasks: Having a holding paddock or yard area for livestock
Cleaning vehicles and farm machinery
Ensuring fodder is weed-free
Regularly inspecting property for weed incursions
Checking watercourses and boundaries for weeds
Inspecting feed distribution areas and new stock locations
Using the Department of Primary Industries Weedwise app for identification and management advice
Knowing the specific weed species present for effective control
Implementing control techniques appropriate for the weed species
Designating a holding area for new livestock
Establishing a cleaning area for vehicles and machinery
Verifying the weed-free status of fodder sources
Regularly walking through the property
Focusing inspections on high-risk areas (e.g., watercourses, boundaries)
Routinely checking new stock and feed distribution sites
Consulting the NSW DPI website
Contacting local authorities for control advice

tasks.task: Managing and controlling weeds on a property
subtasks: Have a holding paddock or yard for new livestock
Have a dedicated cleaning area for vehicles and machinery
Ensure fodder sources are weed-free
Regularly inspect property for weed incursions
Check watercourses and boundaries specifically
Inspect feed distribution areas and new stock locations
Use the Department of Primary Industries Weedwise app for identification and management advice
Know the specific weed species present
Implement appropriate control techniques for each weed species
Designate a holding area for new livestock to eliminate seeds
Establish a cleaning station for vehicles and farm machinery
Verify that all fodder is weed-free before use
Regularly walk through the property to look for new weeds
Focus inspections on high-risk areas like watercourses and boundaries
Check all distribution areas where new stock are introduced
Consult the NSW DPI website for control advice
Contact local authorities if needed for specific assistance
